definition: trusted/intimate/(of the emperor) to visit/variant of 幸[xing4]

sentences.english: With their help, all the apples were picked and put back on the cart.
sentences.chinese: 僥倖的是，蘇和汽車司機都沒受傷。

sentences.english: Don't bet on winning the game.
sentences.chinese: 不要以爲能僥倖贏得比賽。

sentences.english: He called it a narrow escape. But it was really a cliff-hanger .
sentences.chinese: 他稱之爲僥倖逃脫，但那確實讓他膽戰心驚。

sentences.english: Fortunately, Ijurmped back in time to avoid being hit.
sentences.chinese: 很僥倖，我及時往後跳以免費遭撞擊。

sentences.english: I think their last win was just a fluke .
sentences.chinese: 我認爲他們上次獲勝只是僥倖罷了。

sentences.english: He just barely squeaked into the opera without a ticket.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有票僥倖成功進入劇院。

sentences.english: Don't expect to luck through without an effort.
sentences.chinese: 別指望不經努力就能僥倖成功。

sentences.english: The calf had a lucky escape.
sentences.chinese: 小崽很僥倖地逃過一劫。

sentences.english: Four parents all embrace for a night sudden wealth, become famous for a night of by luck mental.
sentences.chinese: 四家長都抱有一夜暴富，一夜成名的僥倖心理。

sentences.english: A would-be defeated troops will engage his enemy first before looking for chances of victory.
sentences.chinese: 打敗戰的軍隊先同敵人交戰，而後希望僥倖取勝。

sentences.english: I believe that happiness is so important, it should not be left to chance.
sentences.chinese: 我相信幸福是這麼重要，他應該留有僥倖心理。

sentences.english: He'd narrowly escaped being thrown into a Bahamian jail.
sentences.chinese: 他僥倖躲過了被扔進巴哈馬監獄。

sentences.english: The psychological cause refers to the sequacious and the fluke mind.
sentences.chinese: 心理原因指盲從與僥倖心理使然。
業務連續性是非常重要的，您不能心存僥倖。

sentences.english: It is truly an honor to be here, and I congratulate you on celebrating your 70th anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 很是僥倖來到這裏，並祝賀你們70週年校慶。

definition: to err/to make a mistake/to do the wrong thing
to follow the track of an overturned cart/to repeat a disastrous policy
to take a wrong step in life (idiom)/to go astray
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
to thwart/to foil (sb's plans)/a setback/a failure/a defeat
things turn out contrary to the way one wishes (idiom)
to sway/to waver/to rock/to rattle/to destabilize/to pose a challenge to
